javax.servlet

Interface AsyncContext


  • public interface AsyncContext
    The execution context of an asynchronous operation on a servlet request. The context is created by calling ServletRequest.startAsync() or ServletRequest.startAsync(javax.servlet.ServletRequest,javax.servlet.ServletResponse). Subsequent call to these methods return the same context instance.
    Since:
    3.0

    • Method Detail

      • getRequest

        ServletRequest getRequest()
        Returns the original request.

      • getResponse

        ServletResponse getResponse()
        Returns the original response.

      • hasOriginalRequestAndResponse

        boolean hasOriginalRequestAndResponse()
        Indicates whether this context was initialized with the original request/response pair.

      • dispatch

        void dispatch()
        Dispatches the request/response pair to the servlet container. If ServletRequest.startAsync(javax.servlet.ServletRequest,javax.servlet.ServletResponse) was called with a HttpServletRequest, then the URI for dispatch will be its request-URI, otherwise the URI will be that of the request when it was last dispatched. The dispatcher type of the request is DispatcherType.ASYNC. This method returns immediately.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if complete() was called, or a dispatch method was called but the startAsync method was not called
        See Also:
        ServletRequest.getDispatcherType()

      • dispatch

        void dispatch(java.lang.String path)
        Dispatches the request/response pair to the specified path. The dispatcher type of the request is DispatcherType.ASYNC. This method returns immediately.
        Parameters:
        path - the dispatch target within the servlet context of this async context
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if complete() was called, or a dispatch method was called but the startAsync method was not called
        See Also:
        ServletRequest.getDispatcherType()

      • dispatch

        void dispatch(ServletContext context,
            java.lang.String path)
        Dispatches the request/response pair to the specified path and context. The dispatcher type of the request is DispatcherType.ASYNC. This method returns immediately.
        Parameters:
        path - the dispatch target within the specified servlet context
        context - the servlet context
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if complete() was called, or a dispatch method was called but the startAsync method was not called
        See Also:
        ServletRequest.getDispatcherType()

      • complete

        void complete()
        Completes this asynchronous operation. The associated response is closed.

      • start

        void start(java.lang.Runnable runnable)
        Requests the servlet container to execute the specified runnable.

      • addListener

        void addListener(AsyncListener listener)
        Adds a listener to receive AsyncEvents for this context.

      • addListener

        void addListener(AsyncListener listener,
               ServletRequest request,
               ServletResponse response)
        Adds a listener to receive AsyncEvents for this context. The specified request and response will be passed in the event.

      • createListener

        <T extends AsyncListener> T createListener(java.lang.Class<T> t)
                                       throws ServletException
        Instantiates an AsyncListener from the given class.
        Throws:
        ServletException

      • setTimeout

        void setTimeout(long timeout)
        Sets the timeout in milliseconds for this context.

      • getTimeout

        long getTimeout()
        Returns the timeout in milliseconds for this context.
